H0.text: what is the main mineral in lithium batteries. Cobalt

H1.text: what is the main mineral in lithium batteries. Nickel

H2.text: what is the main mineral in lithium batteries. Graphite

H3.text: what is the main mineral in lithium batteries. lithium

A4.text: In 2016, 89% of lithium-ion batteries contained graphite (43% artificial and 46% natural).

A5.text: The negative electrode is usually graphite, although silicon is often mixed in to increase the capacity.
